name: Clin N Intrahepatic Bile Ducts
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 2:** For right-liver intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, the regional lymph nodes include the hilar (common bile duct, hepatic arteries, portal vein, and cystic duct), periduodenal and peripancreatic lymph nodes. 

**Note 3:** For left-liver intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma, regional lymph nodes include hilar and gastrohepatic lymph nodes.

**Note 4:**  Caval nodes are classified as distant nodes and coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Regional lymph nodes:**

    Hilar:
        Common bile duct
        Cystic duct
        Hepatic, NOS:
            Hepatic artery
            Hepatic pedicle
        Hepatoduodenal ligament
        Portal vein:
            Porta hepatis
            Periportal
    Inferior phrenic nodes
  
    Primary tumor in left liver (segments 2-4) or lobe of liver not stated:
        Gastrohepatic

    Primary tumor in right liver (segments 5-8) or lobe of liver not stated:
        Periduodenal
        Peripancreatic

     Primary tumor involving both lobes of liver:
         Gastrohepatic
         Periduodenal
         Peripancreatic
rows: Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed

Clinical evaluation but unknown results or regional lymph node involvement not stated
Clinical evaluation done but results not documented in patient record

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinical N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No clinical evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
